intro: Pervinca sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian Crown Vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. Pervinca sicula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
